200004.text: The tower appears to be haunted by a large number of resentful spirits. Please be cautious of them.

200005.text: There seems to be the breath of other humans in the tower as well.

200006.text: There seems to be a monster spawned by the gathering of the undead inside the tower. Attack the monster continuously to weaken it.

200008.text: Don't be fooled by their appearances, for the monsters that lack real strength will try to put on a frightening display.

200009.text: Only by collecting all the Mirror Shards can we restore its power.

200010.text: Have you lost an item? How about asking the residents of the forest about it?

200011.text: Master, your fate cannot be defied by anything but your own choices.

200012.text: The power must come from somewhere. Perhaps because of some unusual objects?

200014.text: Master, even you may feel tired sometimes, right? If you are tired, please come back here and take a good rest.

200016.text: When magic creeps into your body, your mind will also be affected. Under its influence, even the tamest person can become ferocious.

200017.text: Master, the magic will devour both your body and your mind once it takes hold of you. Maybe we can gather more clues if we manage to find the source of the magic.

200018.text: What do you mean by a "precious" thing? This is a word that seems incomprehensible to me. Perhaps you could ask someone else?

200019.text: It's my duty to wait here for you.

200021.text: It seems like there's some sort of magic that can put people into a slumber. But there should be a chance to avoid it when the spell is being cast?

200022.text: Some vines in the forest can also detect the power of humans. They may try to block your way forward.

200024.text: The source of the power in the forest must be difficult to eradicate, right?

200025.text: Men of the Holy Church have also entered the Chrono Tower, and they are up to something, from the look of it.

200026.text: The mirror in the Hall of Snegurochka acts as the gateway to the new world.

200028.text: I'm afraid that this biting coldness isn't something a human body can withstand. It might be possible to stop the blizzard if we find out what caused it.

200032.text: But understanding is the first step in solving conflict, and it's a step that most people lack the courage to take.

200035.text: Magic is mystical, unique, and perfect... Your magic does not frighten them, but the unknown does.

200037.text: The fiercer the outward appearance is, the more the heart craves warmth. It is what one lacks that is most desired.

200039.text: Fate is not for people like me to question...No one can decide your fate, Master. I'll stand by your side, whatever your decision might be.

200042.text: Master, you seem to be trembling? Maybe that's the so-called "shivers"? Or maybe that's not quite the same...

200043.text: My master, don't be so harsh on yourself. Put on more layers to withstand the biting coldness of Snegurochka.

200044.text: The Saintess of Snegurochka? She gives out a feel like an iceberg, or like a statue that has no human emotion, right?

200045.text: If it is the Protector who summoned the blizzard, then I'm afraid only she can be the one to lift it.

200046.text: I think there's a kind of magic that can seal people in an ice wall. If you fail to break free quickly, you'll be damaged by the sheer coldness.

200047.text: If you try to dodge blindly when caught in the blizzard, you will only suffer more damage.

200048.text: It is dangerous to keep afflicted by debuffs in combat, and it is wiser to dispel them as quickly as possible.

200049.text: Crystallizing is quite a refined and advanced Ice magic. Getting hit by it can be more than hazardous.

200050.text: If you ever find yourself in poor conditions during your expeditions, please come back in time to refresh yourself.

200051.text: Searching for better equipment? Check out my Workshop!

200052.text: As long as you can afford the cost, I can make you the best equipment!

200080.text: Guard of the Frost Chivalric Order

200084.text: I cannot allow you to stop the blizzard. If it stops, the world will soon end with it.

200085.text: Therefore, to safeguard this world, I shall eliminate you! I cannot allow you to lift the blizzard. Doing so would be dangerous. The survival of the world depends on it.

200095.text: Phrygia the Chevalier, join the battle!

200096.text: You can't defeat me simply by destroying this vessel!

200099.text: You pathetic little puppet! You really think you can save the world from destruction by yourself?

200100.text: You're not getting your way this time.

200146.text: Sentry of the Frost Chivalric Order

200147.text: Guard of the Frost Chivalric Order

200168.text: Chevalier of the Frost Chivalric Order

200177.text: Be careful, this place is different from how I remember it. It is full of traps now.

200178.text: Please be careful, there's an unpleasant aura ahead.

200180.text: So, what should I call you this time?

200181.text: There is a strong smell of blood coming from the road ahead.

200183.text: Don't get any closer. It's dangerous here. Back off!

200184.text: Thank you for saving my life. I'm Deluca. I didn't expect to see anyone here. Looks like the legend of the treasure in this tower has traveled far!

200185.text: Surely, sooner or later, you will need help in your expedition. My information should come in handy.

200187.text: I hear you. Go ahead, the unknown future is waiting for you.

200188.text: Master, I called you to the tower.

200189.text: It seems your power has fully awoken.

200190.text: The vessel hanging on your belt is filled with souls. Pour them into the spring and start summoning.

200191.text: Nice dolls. Feel free to interact with them.

200192.text: You can imbue those magic dolls with souls collected from different worlds to have them fight for you in combat.

200193.text: Yes, master. Only you can summon souls from the Intangible Radius through contracts.

200194.text: From your world or not, the souls will be able to enter your dolls in the form of Elements, and revive with the help of your power.

200195.text: Since you just woke up, your power hasn't been fully restored. So, please take care of yourself. With time, your power will increase and you will be able to sign contracts with more powerful souls and summon them in combat.

200196.text: This is a Shard of the Irminsul Mirror and it still has some residual power from the Chronospace Protector.

200197.text: The mirror shards are scattered throughout the tower.

200198.text: My master, you are the host of the Star of Fate and I am your maid, here at your service.

200199.text: The Mirror of Irminsul once belonged to Lady Ereshkigal, the Chronospace Protector. Only you can use it.

200200.text: The Chrono Tower is an incomplete remnant that was once used to manage time and space.

200201.text: Now, it has been deserted and even become a lair of monsters, so please be extra careful.

200203.text: Master, it was most definitely a critical moment just now.

200204.text: But don't worry. At the brink of danger, I will turn back time by a few moments and bring you back to my side.

200205.text: Hello again... The monsters have left.

200206.text: The tower is dangerous, be sure to be careful, Meow!

200208.text: How did you get into this tower...

200209.text: This is no place for playing around.

200211.text: If you can't undo a spell as simple as that, you'd better leave now.

200212.text: This tower is full of mysteries. I'm going back to my research now.

200213.text: If you've got nothing important, don't disturb me.

200214.text: Human, I can't believe that you have defeated the monster. This power... Did you just absorb its soul?

200215.text: You, a human appearing out of nowhere, have an unknown power.

200216.text: That's the magic of the Chronospace Protector: hosting the souls of monsters with merely a mortal body.

200217.text: Countless followers worshiped the great Chronospace Protector just like me, for eternity is her destiny.

200218.text: Human, we meet again. That mercenary has been talking about beating monsters non-stop since she woke up. No doubt she's alive and well.

200220.text: Wait, the silver hair, the eyes... So similar to... familiar...

200221.text: For a moment, I thought the Chronospace Protector was still here... It appears that you're no ordinary human.

200222.text: It's been so long since I last saw another human being. I'm exhilarated...

200223.text: Oh right! Did you notice the shard in front of you? It's believed that there are 5 pieces in total.

200224.text: That's a relic from the War of Protectors. It is said that the Chronospace Protector once used it to untie the Binding of the Intangible.

200225.text: The mighty Chronospace Protector can defy the Binding of the Intangible Radius to reach across time and space. Such power!

200226.text: This is not something that we can comprehend.

200227.text: That's all I know. But I am convinced that only you can inherit the power of Chronospace Protector, only you...

200228.text: There are other monsters nearby. It's my job to eliminate them.

200229.text: So, human with silver hair, may we meet again.

200230.text: Master, there is only one shard left. That's a must for you to find it.

200231.text: Yes, master. There is only one shard left. That's a must for you to find it.

200232.text: Now, please go back to the bottom of the tower and get some rest. I'll be here waiting for you.

200234.text: I just heard from Laksha about what happened. Thank you for saving my life.

200235.text: I'm Deluca, head of the Mercenaries.

200236.text: I didn't expect to see anyone here. Looks like the legend of the treasure in this tower has traveled far!

200237.text: I can't believe that you have defeated that monster. It's impressive.

200238.text: Again, thanks for your help. I'm looking forward to our next encounter.

200239.text: Norr, I just escaped with bare life and came this close to never see you again.

200241.text: Norr, can you help me? My fellows were all killed by the monster. I'm the only survivor, but I won't be able to find a way out of this tower without a better weapon.

200242.text: Sure but... you must promise to pay me.

200243.text: Yes, don't worry. I'll pay you for sure.

200244.text: I need some materials first. Come find me in the Workshop at the Hall of Origin.

200246.text: Norr is a reliable child, and her forging skills are second to none.

200247.text: She can forge not only weapons, but even pots, kitchen knives, and all kinds of utensils.

200248.text: Haha, you love getting to the bottom of things, don't you? As I said before, mercenaries only work for money.

200249.text: My employer received information from the Holy Church that some great treasure is hidden within the tower. It's a great opportunity to strike it rich, but I didn't expect to encounter such a dangerous monster.

200250.text: Without your help, I'd be dead in the tower already. Would you like to go treasure hunting with me?

200252.text: I'll never forget that you saved my life. As soon as I find any new information, I'll let you know, warts and all.

200253.text: So, I hope you can bring me more information about the treasure when we meet again. Good luck!

200254.text: Who are you? Why are you here?

200255.text: Well, did Deluca tell you that?

200256.text: My name is Noaidi. I'm an outstanding blacksmith.

200257.text: If you need high-quality weapons, just come to me and I'll customize them for you.

200258.text: Of course, if you find any rare ores here, you may take them to me as well. I'll make good use of them.

200259.text: Don't thank me yet. I'm not doing this for free. My commission is quite high.

200260.text: If you need anything, come find me in the Workshop at the bottom of the tower.

200261.text: Master, welcome back. I can see that you've collected all the Shards of the Irminsul Mirror.

200262.text: This is the last piece. Bring all the shards to the Hall of Irminsul.

200263.text: This is the Hall of Irminsul where the Chrono Tower and Irminsul meet, the endpoint of the Intangible Radius.

200264.text: It looks like you've collected all the shards.

200265.text: Go ahead and open the gate of fate.

200266.text: Um... Um? Traveler, did you see my pot?

200268.text: As you can see, I am Sir Phrygia of Irminsul, yes...

200269.text: Um, I'm not so used to this physical form. I feel tired after just a bit of action and have to rest from time to time.

200270.text: Ugh... I just woke up, only to find my pot missing, argh, what a nuisance!

200271.text: Sorry, I lose track of my surroundings when I'm thinking about things. Ribbit, ribbit. I didn't notice that you were here.

200272.text: Ribbit...That pot is very important. Forged with metal and polished by heart, that precious artifact is only used for banquets.

200274.text: You... Leave now! You are not allowed in here!

200275.text: I am Flare, the Priest of Irminsul, and I serve the great Protector.

200276.text: How ignorant of you to call us a cult! We worship the Protector of Irminsul here!

200277.text: You fool! How could you not know the Protector of Irminsul?

200278.text: Protecting the people here is my duty. I shall not forgive those who try to harm them...

200279.text: Flare is warning you. Go back! Now!

200280.text: Flare has warned you loud and clear... How dare you harm the people here!

200281.text: They all are the people of the Protector. They have already been corroded by magic. How could you have the heart to hurt them even more?

200282.text: Still defending yourself? Looks like a little punishment for you is called for!

200283.text: Huff... That's dangerous. That Flare girl activated the Stone Golem. She must be nuts.

200284.text: It's a man-made creature powered by magic. It was supposed to guard this land.

200285.text: That Flare is exceptionally talented in magic, even Protector Asherah has spoken highly of her.

200286.text: You'd better stay away from her. Who knows what danger she could bring next.

200287.text: Don't worry. I'm not going to attack you. It's amazing that someone in this world still retains the human form!

200288.text: It was indeed a catastrophe... The Abnormality mutated our bodies and everyone was groaning in pain.

200289.text: Everyone turned into magical creatures. To find a way to restore ourselves, my brother set out for the heart of the forest, yet has never been seen again.

200290.text: As you can see, I have limited mobility. Would you please ask about him for me on your journey?

200291.text: Oh, thank you so much. Your kindness will eventually be rewarded.

200292.text: Uh, I found that in the forest.

200293.text: This pot belongs to the chevalier? I see. Then, would you please help me return it to its owner?

200294.text: Um... Um? It's you. Oh! Isn't that my pot?

200295.text: Ribbity-rok. Thank you so much! Please take this. It's believed to contain magical powers.

200296.text: Now, I just need my wand so that I can keep my vows.

200297.text: What? Don't mind that. I've made vows as a chevalier so I must keep them.

200298.text: This is... the Music Box of Time. It allows you to go back to the dreams you had before.

200300.text: Huh? A human who has not been corroded by magic!

200301.text: Don't go! Let me tell you a big secret.

200303.text: I know I don't look like it now... but Soleil the Singer used to be a prince charming.

200304.text: I once attracted countless girls by singing under a tree.

200305.text: But my memory is fading day by day. I've even forgotten my most renowned song.

200306.text: Uh-huh! I knew you would say yes.

200307.text: If you can bring the songbook back to me, I'll tell you another big secret!

200308.text: I vaguely remember that I've kept it in a chest. That songbook is my dear treasure!

200309.text: Bring it to the Sentry Camp if you manage to find it. I'll be waiting there for you.

200310.text: Unsettling magic is emanating everywhere in Irminsul. An Abnormality might have occurred.

200311.text: My master, please be careful. When you feel tired, return to the tower to have some rest.

200312.text: Some kind of Abnormality might have taken place here. If so, my knowledge won't be of any help. Please be careful. When you feel tired, return to the tower to have some rest.

200313.text: My master, welcome back. This is...

200314.text: Yes, my master. It can bring you into the Dreamworld. Would you like to have a try?

200315.text: Well then, if I may, please allow me to guide you into the Dreamworld.

200316.text: This place is also different from how I remembered it.

200317.text: Who told you that? Someone from here? Or was it Erina?

200318.text: She's your maid... I can't believe she still remembers this place...

200319.text: Nothing. Just so you know, Asherah, the Protector of this place, is quite stubborn. She won't listen to anyone.

200320.text: So are her people. Try to avoid any confrontation with them.

200321.text: So... Why did you enter that tower?

200322.text: Traveler, don't be afraid, please stay.

200323.text: As you can see, this used to be a glorious nation. My name is Ökam. I'm a traveling businessman.

200324.text: At the north end of the Irene Island, across the ocean where the horizon ends, lies my hometown...

200325.text: It sits by the seaside, surrounded by water on three sides and covered with lantern flowers. It was once one of the most prosperous commercial cities.

200326.text: Alas, it's all ruined. Plants are now growing like crazy.

200327.text: I've buried my life-long savings in different places and escaped with my family.

200328.text: I lost my families one after another, until I became the only one left.

200329.text: I really want to retrieve my treasures, but I would definitely be attacked by those monsters if I go there alone.

200330.text: Seems like it's nothing but a dream that will never come true.

200331.text: Really? I can't thank you enough. I'll work up some courage and go with you.

200332.text: Please take this chest and what's within. Consider it a gift of my gratitude for your kind help.

200333.text: The nearest one from here is my precious armor. It's right at the shop in the market.

200335.text: Alas, this was the most prosperous market in Irminsul. Now it's in ruins.

200336.text: The fine armor that I buried here will never be found again...

200337.text: My hometown, most likely, suffered the same fate...

200338.text: Oh, sorry to burden you with my sorrow. When you are my age, it's easy to get caught up in memories of the past.

200340.text: I used to own a store on the shopping street there. That's where I buried the treasures that I've saved up all these years.

200341.text: That's the one who's been following Phrygia around.

200342.text: You don't belong to this world. Get out of here now!

200343.text: Humph, how could that one who only knows how to wield a sword use any magic? Don't be ridiculous!

200344.text: I'm going to prepare for the ritual now. Leave if you wish to stay alive.

200345.text: The next time I see you, I'll take your life in the name of the Protector!

200346.text: I've lost the courage to move on. It's better to just die here!

200347.text: It is the once supreme goddess who turned us into this!

200348.text: Restoring our original appearance seems impossible now.

200349.text: Oh, so you've met my brother?

200350.text: As you can see, this is how I look now. I've lost all hope.

200351.text: My brother is the only one I'm missing now, and I don't think I'll ever see him again or tell him about my regrets.

200352.text: Yeah, that was a horrendous disaster. Massive amounts of magic leaked out.

200353.text: I was on the Fomoire Island, learning under Lady Raphan. Lady Raphan's divination foretold that the Abnormality would happen here.

200354.text: I rushed back here, only to find everyone had agonizingly turned into the likes of monsters.

200355.text: I watched helplessly as everything happened. The town was eventually deserted, and I couldn't do a thing about it...

200356.text: Maybe I could find a way to restore everything if I manage to find the source of the magic.

200357.text: With that tiny hope, I set out into the forest.

200358.text: ... I never thought I would also turn into something like this.

200359.text: Lady Raphan's divination guided me to the Giant Tree at the heart of the forest. That's where the throne of the Protector lies.

200361.text: The Sentry Camp ahead originally belonged to the household guards. They are quite bellicose, so better keep your distance from them.

200362.text: This is... was a prosperous district. People of all sorts—officers, warriors, civilians—would frequent the taverns here. Those were the happy days.

200363.text: It was such a happy time. I exchanged half of my assets for gold and silver wares, and buried them underneath my shop.

200364.text: But now, I can't find my shop anymore...

200365.text: Sorry, I've indulged myself in such mundane memories again.

200366.text: Seems like I'm next to broke now... The only savings I have left are hidden under the lantern flowers in my hometown.

200367.text: My lower back is aching again. Let's just keep moving.

200368.text: I'm afraid my aged body cannot hold on for much longer.

200370.text: I traveled so far... only to find... that actually this is the most precious treasure...

200371.text: Kind person, thank you. I think this is the end for me...

200372.text: But I did see my hometown one last time before forever closing my eyes...

200373.text: (Tears in eyes) My hometown... My Avril, I can finally see you again.

200375.text: He collapsed before finishing his sentence and never wakes up again.

200377.text: Ribbit, ribbit. Meet again. Have you found my wand?

200378.text: I think that guy said somewhere around here. Why can't we find it? Ribbity-rok...

200379.text: Oh, it's someone I used to know, ribbit... Though turned into a caterpillar, he's still worried about his missing little brother.

200380.text: Oh, you've met him. I sent him to the Giant Tree Periphery. He used to live there with his younger brother.

200381.text: What? Who told you that secret?

200382.text: I feel the same way too. Lady Asherah has been acting strangely. She won't receive any visitors.

200384.text: The people of Irminsul are in significant pain because of the Abnormality. Only by finding the cause of the Abnormality can we turn everyone back to their original form.

200385.text: The prophecy of the Six Ovates of the Fomoire Island alone is not enough. Could you please gather more clues?

200386.text: Ribbit, ribbit... Thank you so much. I've sworn to protect this land, and that's what I'm going to do.

200387.text: You, over there, halt! Oh, it's you!

200388.text: Fantastic. It's been so hard lately, not having anyone pursuing me! But with this, I can now...

200390.text: Erm, what's that sound! I... You should leave now!

200392.text: I can see that you've encountered some powerful creatures in the world of Irminsul.

200393.text: Flare, why won't Lady Asherah see me!?

200394.text: Insolence! How dare you address the Protector disrespectfully by name!

200395.text: The Protector has poured all her heart into the study of magic that will prevent Irminsul from breaking apart. Even I cannot seek an audience with her, let alone a chevalier like you!

200396.text: Is Lady Asherah studying magic that will prevent the collapse, or...

200397.text: Are you having doubts about your faith? You and I have both sworn to follow the Protector...

200398.text: It's not like that... I will never break my vows...

200399.text: But Flare, this is way too strange. The Protector used to be so tender...

200400.text: Silence! The world is about to fall apart. Only the Protector has the power to save it.

200401.text: But everyone is in pain... People are...

200402.text: Without the Protector, the world will cease to exist!

200406.text: I've sworn to guard this land, but Lady Asherah seems...

200409.text: It's okay. I have already found the clues. I just haven't made up my mind yet...

200411.text: I have to ask you for a favor. Please help me find my wand. That's the key to the Ruin of the Giant Tree.

200412.text: Ribbity-rok. Thank you. I'll be waiting for you at the entrance of the Ruin, if I manage to make up my mind.

200413.text: I need to get some rest now. I'll count on you for everything.

200414.text: I have warned you multiple times. Why won't you leave?!

200415.text: You say you're going to help them, yet you keep attacking them. You are just as hypocritical as that dumb chevalier!

200416.text: Seems like you've made up your mind! Then waste my time no more. Since you've chosen death, I'd love to grant it to you!

200417.text: In the name of the Protector, I shall put you to death, you heretic!

200418.text: This cold soul... It feels somewhat familiar.

200420.text: Argh... Let all creatures perish... So painful... Please, make it stop...

200421.text: Only loyal chevaliers can enter this place. That wand...

200422.text: Who are you? Why haven't you been turned into a magical creature?

200424.text: Witch from another world, you have not yet comprehended the true essence of this world.

200425.text: Prosperity is always followed by death. This world is falling apart.

200426.text: As its Protector, I have to stop this tragedy from happening.

200427.text: My name is Asherah. I am the Protector of Irminsul, the land of glory.

200428.text: My people are sacrificed in exchange for eternal power. They will become the soil that gives birth to a brand new world.

200429.text: The goblet was slammed to the floor, shattered.

200430.text: I do really need some rest after such intense combat.

200431.text: I'm still really not used to this frog body. Just constantly in need of rest.

200432.text: Raindrops... The magic seems to be clearing away. Change has begun, even though Irminsul has not been fully restored.

200433.text: I'm still really not used to this frog body. Just constantly in need of rest.

200435.text: Thanks for your help. I shall go on fulfilling my mission.

200436.text: Phrygia, the Glorious Chevalier, swears to guard Irminsul.

200437.text: Young witch, may our paths cross again.

200438.text: And may your soul be redeemed too!

200440.text: Oh, here we meet again. I was worried about you!

200441.text: The chevalier brought me here. I thanked him, but he said it was his duty as a chevalier.

200442.text: Really? You've seen my brother? Well, knowing that he's alive is enough for me.

200443.text: Sir Phrygia is standing solemnly at the entrance to the Ruin of the Giant Tree. Did something happen?

200445.text: How is that possible? That's the Protector's throne we are talking about!

200448.text: Of the chevaliers who have sworn loyalty to the Protector, Sir Phrygia is the most loyal one. The Protector puts great trust in him.

200449.text: He considers protecting Irminsul his greatest honor...

200450.text: Oh, I'm sorry that I've kept talking to myself for so long...

200451.text: The chevalier is waiting for you at the entrance to the ruin. Please follow me. May the light be with you!

200452.text: Erm... Hm? Nice to see you again!

200453.text: Oh! Ribbity-rok. Thank you so much. We can enter the Ruin now.

200454.text: Erm... Well, only when you're qualified to enter the Ruin, that gate will open up for you and the road to the throne will then reveal itself.

200455.text: Well, that's the sign of being qualified.

200456.text: Now, we have to imbue the wand with magic first to restore it.

200458.text: Ribbit, ribbit. So, you've noticed that too. The leakage of magic ruined Irminsul.

200459.text: I swore by my sword to protect this beloved world. But while I pray it can be saved in my long wait, all I've gotten is ever-lasting pain.

200460.text: But now, I have made up my mind.

200461.text: Since I've sworn to protect this world on my name as a chevalier, I have to keep my word.

200462.text: The chevalier is right by me, he should know how to enter the ruins.

200463.text: The road sign reads Northern Irene Island—Pannonia.

200464.text: How! How can you keep your human form?

200465.text: The Sentry Camp is up ahead. No visitors allowed!

200466.text: Phrygia, the Glorious Chevalier? He entrusted you?

200468.text: Phrygia's swordsmanship is definitely top-notch, acknowledged even by the Protector, but he knows absolutely no magic, let alone how to use a wand!

200469.text: Right, she's still in her human form; she must be the one causing all the mutation!

200471.text: Please be careful, my master. It appears that the creatures in the forest are slowly losing their minds.

200473.text: You'll know who's right after you die!

200474.text: You say you're a chevalier, yet you betrayed your vows... You betrayed me...

200475.text: I once served a Protector who loved this land. But now she has become the source of this chaos.

200476.text: A Protector who has gotten her hands on the forbidden magic...should be eliminated. That's a way of keeping my vows.

200477.text: I've laughed enough at this. You, the fallen chevalier who betrayed me, shall be cursed with death.

200478.text: It's... It is you who defeated the Protector?

200479.text: Lady Asherah... I can't save you...

200480.text: But I shall stick to my vows as a chevalier to guard this land.

200481.text: Finally... I have failed to guard this land...

200482.text: Ugh... Prey is becoming scarcer. Now it seems like a must for us to walk into the blizzard and hunt above the hillside, doesn't it?

200483.text: The youngsters in our forces are getting increasingly impatient. I need to figure out a way to calm them down.

200485.text: You should not be here. The snowstorm is heavy. Go home now!

200486.text: Oh, so that guy was plotted against. I see.

200487.text: Thank you for this piece of crucial information, my friend.

200488.text: You don't look like you're from here...

200490.text: Not really, to be honest, for we have been living with blizzards for generations.

200491.text: Here we meet again. Looks like you've defeated the Protector of Irminsul.

200492.text: Meow, that's classified... Although, in the War of Protectors, Asherah was firmly against the Chronospace Protector.

200493.text: I still remember that horrible scene... Ereshkigal was defeated by the alliance of other Protectors and lost everything in the end.

200494.text: You've already met Asherah. As for the other Protectors, they are all the dominators of their own worlds, whose duty is to make sure their worlds are functioning properly.

200495.text: Since you are an outsider, they will naturally see you as an anomaly, and try to eliminate you with all their might!

200496.text: I've been talking too much. I'm tired. Gonna sleep now.

200497.text: There used to be a magic circle on the road ahead to keep outsiders from entering.

200498.text: But from the look of it, it's been broken. I think someone just passed before us.

200499.text: If you still have questions, just ask Erina. Unlike me, she'll answer you in more detail.

200500.text: Human, here we meet again. I just broke the magic circle that restricts others from entering here.

200501.text: It was supposed to keep anyone from passing through except the followers of the Chronospace Protector.

200502.text: I think I have told you before. The Chronospace Protector can defy the Binding of the Intangible Radius to reach across different time and space.

200503.text: Her greatness is beyond our comprehension. So, as her followers, we just pledge loyalty to the Chronospace Protector.

200504.text: That's right. The other Protectors joined forces against her. We were outnumbered and eventually defeated.

200505.text: Most followers lost their glory just like me, and have been trapped in different worlds of Chaos.

200506.text: We can only pray that the Protector can be revived, who will lead us to break free from the binding of the Intangible Radius and arrive in the ideal world of order.

200507.text: True. Actually I know very little, and most are nothing but conjectures. The only thing I can do is pray.

200508.text: Master, you look worried. Did something happen?

200509.text: There seem to be some discrepancies between what she said and what I know, but I don't know much myself...

200510.text: I'm your maid. I shouldn't conjecture things.

200511.text: I don't know much, to be honest. All I know is that my duty is to serve you. I've been waiting for your awakening.

200512.text: If you're still confused, please go to Snegurochka. That's the final battleground of the War of Protectors. Maybe you can find your answer there.

200513.text: Please be careful; the road you're setting foot on is full of obstacles. I will assist you if you are in danger. Farewell.

200514.text: Speak no more. You're the Executor of Darkness, right? I, Anemone, the Justice Bringer, shall dispel all evil!

200515.text: Young lady, seems like you just refuse to listen.

200516.text: I'm only slightly interested in the lost civilization. If you've got nothing important, just leave me alone.

200517.text: You, the villain who attempts to perform the Dark Rite!

200519.text: Of course, the company of the fiend has arrived! Anemone, the Justice Bringer, will not yield!

200523.text: I just got sand in my eyes. You have a problem with that?

200524.text: Don't dare think this is the end, you villains who hanker for the Dark Rite!

200525.text: Keep struggling, you followers of the darkness! It's not over yet!

200527.text: Me? I'm just studying the scripts on the wall out of curiosity. Then this little girl has been pestering me like crazy.

200528.text: That's all her hallucination. These ancient scripts seem to record some lost magic. I need to continue now. Please leave me alone.

200529.text: You again! Are you here to bully Anemone again?

200531.text: That's mine... You don't look like a bad guy...

200533.text: Anemone is the Executor of the Holy Church. Anyone who tries to practice the forbidden magic will be the Church's enemy.

200534.text: Purging those heretics who attempt to perform the Dark Rite is Anemone's job.

200535.text: Rumor has it that this tower was originally built by the heretics, where their followers studied the forbidden magic with them.

200536.text: Their behavior angered the Supreme God, who, therefore, sealed the heretics.

200537.text: But some clues to the forbidden magic have been left behind. As a result, many people with less-than-noble intentions enter the tower in an attempt to learn the forbidden magic.

200538.text: That alchemist? She has also been tempted by the forbidden magic, which can be more than dangerous.

200539.text: The preacher is right. Heretics have shown up in the tower and they covet the forbidden magic.

200540.text: If I see them again, I'll make sure to eliminate them all.

200541.text: You look different from them. You are not so interested in magic.

200542.text: Treasure hunting? Doesn't seem so. What are you doing here then?

200543.text: Huh? What's that nonsense? You're really strange.

200544.text: Never mind. Anemone suggests that you stay away from those forbidden magic seekers. They're dangerous.

200545.text: I still have a job to do. So, farewell.

200546.text: Here we meet again. Are you looking for something?

200547.text: I see. Cersivey, the Protector of Snegurochka, can be quite harsh. She's the most devoted follower.

200548.text: Meow, why not ask Cersivey? Though you might be taught a lesson.

200549.text: Those old geezers are cunning. We need to find some other ways.

200550.text: Will of Blizzard, please judge these defilers!

200552.text: No... We are counting on these to live...

200553.text: Yes. We used to live near the hillside where food was plentiful.

200554.text: Yet, one day, a wolf pack showed up and took our land. We were forced to move to the tundra forest in the foothills.

200555.text: But recently, the hunters have been using that place as one of their hunting grounds. Quite a few of my companions were killed by them. Howl...

200556.text: We had no choice but to move here so that we can hide from those hunters.

200557.text: There's not much food around here, so humans seldom come here as well.

200558.text: And for that reason, we can only manage to survive by stealing food at night from the village nearby.

200559.text: We just want to live. What's wrong with that? Howl...

200560.text: Please don't lead the hunters to us. Please...

200562.text: We can move to somewhere else if you promise that you won't lead the hunters to us.

200563.text: The food is sufficient for us to migrate again. Thank you.

200564.text: Howl... We can't live without food... Howl...

200565.text: We can move to somewhere else if you promise that you won't lead the hunters to us. The food is sufficient for us to migrate again.

200566.text: Howl... Thank you! The food is sufficient for us to migrate again. Thank you.

200567.text: My master, what's wrong? You look as though something is weighing heavy on your heart.

200568.text: If you have already made up your mind, why are you still troubled?

200569.text: I can't share your burden, but I understand your decision.

200570.text: You can have countless choices to make, yet no decision can be absolutely right. All you can do at the moment is just to make that choice, then see how it goes.

200571.text: If you are still troubled, I would also love to share the pain with you.

200572.text: I'm your maid. I'll be by your side forever. Please take care of yourself in your adventure. Don't be too hard on yourself.

200573.text: Well then, take care and goodbye.

200574.text: Hey! Who are you! Did those old geezers send you here to spy on us?

200575.text: You look sneaky already. Humph! As a member of the Glorious Silverbow, I cannot let you leave now that you've found out about our plan!

200576.text: Ah! That ring belongs to Lord Silverbow! Now I'm terribly sorry. Please allow me to apologize for my rash behavior!

200577.text: As a member of the Glorious Silverbow, I extend you my sincere apologies.

200579.text: Someone gave me this idea. The old men will definitely come to hunt here. Well, my trap shall grant them a hard time.

200580.text: Look! That area ahead belongs to those old geezers.

200581.text: Conflicts have been going on frequently these days, so better stay away from there.

200582.text: Several old men have already fallen victim to ambushes. The youngsters from the Glorious Silverbow are getting more aggressive every day!

200583.text: Hey, you there! Don't go any further. Go right back to your village!

200584.text: It's too dangerous! The blizzard is heavy and there are wolves every now and then around here!

200585.text: Hey! Go back! I'm heading to the hunting grounds for tomorrow's food.

200586.text: What! Those guys from the Glorious Silverbow are using traps to ambush our old bones, aren't they!

200587.text: Alas, we are getting less prey every day from the hunting grounds near the hillside, plus the wolf pack has occupied the Frozen Lake. We had no choice but to hunt in the foothills.

200588.text: The blizzard is so heavy. It won't be long before this place runs out of prey to hunt.

200590.text:
You are so naive. That's impossible!
There's only so much food; conflicts are inevitable.

200592.text: A human has encroached on our territory! Tear her to shreds!

200593.text: Humph! There is no such thing as a good human. We wolves would never take the initiative to attack humans, yet you keep invading our territories.

200594.text: Humans will hold their swords and invade our territories, even when food is plentiful, let alone scarce.

200595.text: Misunderstanding? How naive. Well, our leader is at the hillside. Go persuade him if you have the courage!

200596.text: If our leader is willing to reconcile with the villagers, we will surely follow his decision.

200598.text: What? Did I mishear you? Are you out of your mind?

200599.text: They are the ones who invaded our hunting grounds.

200601.text: The wolves used to live in the woods near the Frozen Lake Surface. But recently, they moved to the hillside, where our hunting grounds locate. Food was already scarce, and now they want to compete with us for that little food we have.

200602.text: Forget it! Unless the wolves return to their old habitat once and for all, we'll use our bows and arrows to remove them from this land.

200607.text: The Hillside Tundra is where the pack settles now, but we don't welcome humans.

200609.text: Oh, my friend! I'm glad to see you safe and sound.

200610.text: There's not enough prey already, and I'm afraid the young men in the organization are not that forgiving.

200611.text: We could probably catch a lot more prey if it weren't for this horrid weather.

200612.text: My friend, I hope that you're still safe and sound when we meet next time.

200613.text: Alright, I'll consider your suggestion when the time comes.

200614.text: Young one, my men told me that there's a dire bear on the hillside. Please be careful!

200615.text: Stay away from me! Help! Please don't eat me!

200616.text: Howl— Another one with a death wish!

200617.text: Ugh! I followed the Saintess to stop the Geothermal Surge and that cost me too much energy... How could I lose to a human otherwise...

200618.text: I'll get you for this, you little brat!

200619.text: Thank you for saving me. Sorry that I was being so rude to you.

200620.text: Oh, that beast has been around in the nearby woods recently.

200621.text: It attacks whoever enters the woods for no reason. Many hunters have met with misfortune already.

200622.text: I was also attacked just then. If it wasn't for you, I can't imagine what would happen to me.

200623.text: Darn it. Got to figure out a way to repel it out of the woods.

200624.text: That's great, but it is a beast nonetheless. Please be careful!

200625.text: Howl! Human, it's very impressive of you to get here all the way through the blizzard.

200626.text: Howl! Humans keep intruding upon wolves' territories. It's not a problem that can be settled easily.

200627.text: Yes, the forest by the Frozen Lake was our settlement for generations.

200628.text: But a white bear shows up there recently, which is believed to be a henchman of the Saintess up the mountain.

200629.text: We were forced to move here because it destroyed our old settlement.

200630.text: Our ancestors have taught us that only the strong can survive the blizzard.

200631.text: Unless that White Bear leaves our territory.

200632.text: Otherwise, we'll just have to take this place, and we won't be persuaded to act otherwise.

200633.text: Of course, the weather has also helped further antagonize our relationship with humans.

200634.text: Alas, if only it were that simple. There were some people like you who walked through the blizzard to the mountain top with the same idea, yet not a single person came back.

200635.text: From the look of it, the blizzard can only be stopped by defeating the Protector.

200636.text: I can see the determination in your clear eyes... I suppose nothing can stop you from doing this.

200637.text: Human, I, Fenrir the Snow Wolf, promise you that if you do manage to climb to the mountain top and stop the blizzard, I will negotiate with the humans and try to make peace with them.

200638.text: After all, this cycle of eternal conflict is not something I want either.

200639.text: Will of Blizzard, please protect this child on her way!

200640.text: Human, I'm sorry for doubting you earlier.

200641.text: I will send this child back to her mother. Many thanks for your kindness.

200642.text: Here is a little present for you. I found it on the hunting ground. Feel free to take it. You surely deserve this.

200643.text: You are... I suppose you are a human. It's very impressive of you to get here all the way through the blizzard.

200646.text: The abominable witch who brings disasters! You are still alive!

200647.text: (Uneasy) We sealed you in the War of Protectors. Why...

200648.text: No! A filthy being like you cannot exist in this world!

200649.text: Impossible! You abominable witch! I will not allow you to ruin my world!

200650.text: I will destroy you, the source of this disaster! I will save this broken world!

200651.text: Howl... Nicely done! But what's that eruption over there? It looks dangerous!

200652.text: Rest assured. I will keep my words. We shall retreat to our old settlement and make peace with the villagers.

200653.text: What's your plan? Looks like you won't stay here for long.

200654.text: You become more interesting every minute! Don't worry, I'll do it.

200655.text: Howl. Please take this! We cannot wield the magic inside it, but maybe you will find it useful somewhere.

200656.text: So then, farewell. Will of Blizzard, please protect this child on her way!

200658.text: Walking by yourself in the blizzard is way too dangerous!

200659.text: My first memories are of the snow; it is ceaseless and eternal as ever.

200660.text: A lot of villagers got frozen to death since the blizzard is getting heavier. On top of that, Food has become more than precious and scarce.

200661.text: Rumor has it that the origin of all this disaster is the magic circle at the top of the mountain. It's that atrocious demon who brought this world into an eternal winter.

200662.text: That demon hates us, who cuts off our food supply and even tries to starve us to death!

200663.text: That's way too dangerous. The demon will kill you first!

200664.text: Child, just let go of that thought! C'mon, put this leather coat on first. Don't go too far!

200665.text: Wait! We were kind enough to save your life, yet now you attempt to steal my treasure!

200667.text: Hold on! Well, you're quite disciplined. You didn't take my treasure.

200668.text: You want these treasures, don't you? I can give you one under certain conditions.

200669.text: I sprained my back a couple of days ago and I'm in need of a sturdy crutch. It's just that no wood around here is suitable enough. But there are quite a few strong trees in the hunting grounds in the foothills.

200670.text: If you want to trade for my treasure, fetch me some good wood.

200671.text: Oh, this wood is sturdy and durable indeed. Fantastic.

200672.text: Well, as we agreed earlier, you can pick one from the chest.

200673.text: Oh, you are different from us, aren't you? I think you know how to use magic.

200674.text: Can I ask you for a favor?

200675.text: I'm one of Lord Silverbow's hunters. The land by the lake used to be one of our hunting grounds.

200676.text: Recently, those guys have set up traps there and managed to take that hunting grounds from us.

200678.text: Lord Silverbow should still be at the hunting grounds in the foothills. You can spot him carrying that giant bow.

200679.text: I swear on my bow. May you be safe on your journey.

200680.text: How annoying. Those foxes have stolen my food again. Darn it!

200681.text: You see, I stash my food in different places every time. Yet those foxes always manage to find it all.

200682.text: When I realized my food was stolen and attempted to pursue them, they were already long gone. Darn it!

200683.text: That's fantastic! I heard those cunning foxes live on the tundra outside the village.

200684.text: Please teach them a lesson for me if you find them.

200685.text: I heard that you are going up the mountain?

200686.text: Even though you know magic, it's still way too dangerous!

200687.text: My husband used to be a great hunter. Yet, once, he stepped into the territory of the Fallen God to find prey, where he got attacked by the Fallen God.

200688.text: Yes, our ancestors said that the endless blizzard is the punishment of the Fallen God. But no one knows what exactly happened that offended the Fallen God to that degree.

200689.text: My husband seems to have trespassed the territory of the Fallen God by mistake and shot the Fallen God's pet, which caused the wrath and led to the attack on my husband.

200690.text: That's not all. My husband was barely breathing at that moment, yet the Fallen God did not let him go easily. He was eventually cast in the village by that pet, serving as a warning.

200692.text: My poor husband passed away only after a few days.

200693.text: I can never forget the image of that beast, shot with an arrow, carrying my husband and dumping him on the ground.

200694.text: Since then, no one has dared to cross the Frozen Lake and climb up the mountain to its top ever again.

200695.text: Don't go there! You will be punished by the Fallen God if you go to the mountain top!

200696.text: Don't climb to the mountain top!

200697.text: It's too dangerous! My brother was killed by the Fallen God at the mountain top. It saddens me to this day.

200698.text: My brother's archery was acknowledged by everyone, and that's also what got him killed.

200699.text: He hit a beast when hunting on the mountain, which happened to be the pet of the Fallen God.

200700.text: The Fallen God got furious and seriously wounded my brother, then dumped him back into the village. We were warned not to go up the mountain ever again unless we wish for the same fate.

200701.text: My poor brother lost his life just like that.

200702.text: Don't lose your life in vain. Never do that.

200703.text: It's you again, my friend. I can't believe you really went to the leader of the wolf pack!

200704.text: Under the condition that we drive off the White Bear?

200705.text: That young man already told me that it is you who saved his life. It looks like the power you possess is well beyond our imagination.

200706.text: Nonetheless, that bear works for the Fallen God. It can't be trifled with. Be careful!

200707.text: Those poor souls were all frozen to death.

200710.text: There's a faint sound of breathing in the darkness.

200711.text: Looking towards the white vapor where the sound came from, you see something shiny there.

200712.text: Under the pale moonlight, two little luminous stars are twinkling in the corner of the cave...

200713.text: Turns out to be a pair of clear black eyes, looking towards you. It's a human child.

200714.text: Yet, she looks more than feeble. Only a faint sound of breathing can be heard, showing that she's still alive.

200715.text: In a winter like this, many lives will be lost to the coldness, and there's nothing that can be done about it.

200717.text: Next, branches were thrown into the fire. With the crackling sound of the sticks, the fire erupted instantly.

200718.text: The cave is brightened by the dazzling and warm light.

200719.text: Intimidated by its brightness, the human child dares do nothing but breathe quietly.

200720.text: Gradually, the child that huddled in the corner slowly moves closer to the fire. The desire for warmth began to overcome the emotion of fear.

200721.text: The human child made some happy noises. She can feel that her body is warming up, recovering from the previous coldness.

200722.text: Fire is forbidden in this world!

200723.text: If Cersivey finds out you told humans the secret of fire, she will not let you off easy.

200724.text: Meow, I don't think about things that are too complicated. But I'm afraid that the fate of freezing to death cannot be changed. After all, Cersivey has been keeping this world in an eternal winter.

200726.text: The outer ring was formed by the strongest ones, with other adults occupying the middle layer, while the vulnerable children were protected on the inside...

200727.text: What's more, even the children knew that they should keep the youngest ones in the warmest center. They knew exactly that this would cause them to die earlier...

200729.text: Do you still remember what I said back in the tower?

200730.text: There's no need to ask anymore. You are looking more and more determined. Maybe this time...

200731.text: Oh, it's nothing. Be careful. Cersivey's strength is quite overwhelming. She was the vanguard throughout the War of Protectors.

200732.text: This place is freezing. I'm going back to sleep... Goodbye...

200734.text: What's that? Humans are using some magical item that radiates heat!

200735.text: You are the heretics that will destroy this world!

200736.text: The use of fire is strictly forbidden by the Saintess. How did you find out about the secret of fire?

200737.text: The Protector of this world, our esteemed master, Her Saintess.

200738.text: Nonsense! How did you find out about the secret of fire?

200739.text: Your Saintess, please bring these two heretics to trial! They will bring great disasters to this world!

200740.text: Who are you? You not only know the secret of fire, but also stopped the trial of the heretics...

200741.text: You? Meeting with Her Saintess? In your dreams!

200742.text: You have broken the taboo and made yourselves the enemy of all chevaliers. Things won't end well for you!

200743.text: I went to the settlement of the wolves at the hillside. They were as wary as ever and they did not take my words seriously.

200744.text: Not surprising. Their history with those humans cannot be denied just because of your words.

200745.text: I set traps around the water source of their settlement under cover of night. Now we just need to wait for them to take the bait.

200746.text: Good work. Now the wolf pack will hate humans even more!

200747.text: You've done a great job. You have finished the task given to you by Her Saintess excellently.

200748.text: I tempted the young men from the Glorious Silverbow to set traps for those old bones. Such a shame the old hunters didn't fall for it.

200749.text: Hey! You're the brat from before!

200750.text: Brat, this is the order from the supreme Her Saintess.

200751.text: People who go up the mountain will bring unimaginable disasters to this world.

200752.text: They must be repelled to the foothills. They can't climb to the mountain top and defile Her Saintess!

200753.text: Boss, this brat was eavesdropping on us. She knows our plan now.

200754.text: We can't let her go down the mountain alive!

200755.text: Your Great Saintess, please give us power and judge those blasphemers!

200756.text: Defeated by a brat like you... How humiliating!

200757.text: Boss, we failed the quest given to us by the Saintess. How can we go back to the castle with such shame!

200758.text: Don't worry. I will not attack you anymore. The leader has told me what you had done.

200759.text: Never thought that you would try to chase off the ferocious White Bear. How brave!

200760.text: That's true. We lived there for generations. We don't want to leave that place either.

200761.text: Oh! So, that's what happened. I thought those guys looked sneaky, but I couldn't have imagined they were plotting something so horrible!

200762.text: That's a crucial piece of information. I must report it to the leader right away.

200763.text: I guess you are really different from the others. You are courageous and intelligent, just like our leader.

200764.text: I apologize for being rude to you before. It turns out that I've misunderstood those humans too.

200765.text: Another thing, can you do me a favor?

200766.text: There's a guy who uses a giant bow further down the pass of talus. I was worried that he would inflict harm on the pack.

200767.text: It seems that I've misunderstood him. I should go back now to report to our leader. Could you please return the baggage for me?

200768.text: Thank you so much. And you should be careful about the guys from the Chivalric Order too. See you.

200769.text: Oh, my friend. Here we meet again! I'm glad to see you safe and sound.

200770.text: So, did you find the White Bear?

200771.text: Like I said before, it likes to crack open the Frozen Lake as a way to work out its claws.

200772.text: Ahead is the Frozen Lake Surface. Maybe you'll find it there.

200773.text: I strongly admire your courage and strong will. Maybe you can actually end this endless blizzard...

200774.text: Wait, that backpack looks so familiar. Isn't that my baggage?

200776.text: I also found out that it's the Frost Chivalric Order that has been stirring up troubles and causing constant conflicts between the wolf pack and us. I have already made them pay.

200777.text: Take these as your reward for getting back my baggage.

200778.text: Well, my friend, may our paths cross again.

200779.text: I can finally rest for a couple of days now. I've been dealing with the geothermal surge by the side of Her Saintess, and that exhausted me.

200781.text: Nasty little thing. How dare you come to Hervoraltar after what you've done!

200783.text: Child, where did you learn this nonsense and even try to lecture me?

200784.text: Her Saintess said that they shall disappear. I've got to comply with her order, stomping them into the mud!

200785.text: Grrr! That's Hervoraltar's master, the great Protector.

200786.text: Child, I was careless last time. But this time, you won't be so lucky!

200788.text: Argh, I can't believe I lost again...

200789.text: Impossible... Hervoraltar was defeated by a human...

200790.text: Come to the Glacial Castle at the mountain top if you dare. Her Saintess will avenge me!

200792.text: Is that the mountain top? This is also my first time being here.

200793.text: Howl! Awfully brave! You really made it! That's unbelievable.

200794.text: My children have told me everything. Thanks to your victory against the White Bear, we can finally return to our home now.

200795.text: You've been keeping true to your word. Impressive! Howl!

200796.text: To be honest, I don't know much about the Saintess either. Humans prefer to call her the Fallen God rather than the Saintess.

200797.text: This place has been managed by the Saintess since the age of my great-great-grandpa... Well, since the wolves started to live here.

200798.text: Those from the Frost Chivalric Order are the followers of the Saintess. Therefore, anyone who stands in her way will be eliminated by them.

200799.text: All I know is that the Saintess lives in the Glacial Castle at the mountain top. No one has been there before except the Chivalric Order.

200800.text: Haha, I have no idea. Since my earliest memories, it has always been there.

200801.text: From around the time our kind settled here, it has never stopped even once.

200802.text: It's just that the blizzard has been getting heavier lately, making it even harder for us to find food.

200803.text: Human, I admire your courage and wisdom.

200804.text: The mountain top is just over there. The Saintess and her henchmen must have set up countless obstacles there. Please be careful.

200805.text: Will of Blizzard, please protect this child on her way!

200806.text: Hey! You are not supposed to be here!

200807.text: How dare you speak the name of Her Saintess!

200808.text: So, it is you who have upset our plans time after time! You're grievously sinful, for you have broken the taboo of fire!

200809.text: Are you planning to keep going against the will of Her Saintess?

200810.text: What a joke! This endless blizzard is what Her Saintess wants. If the blizzard stops, this world will end with it!

200811.text: Ignorant fool! And how dare you disobey Her Saintess!

200812.text: Speak no more. You shall pay for your sin of defiling Her Saintess with your blood!

200813.text: This is the Saintess's castle... How spectacular!

200814.text: Then we need to find the Saintess in the castle, and ask her to stop the blizzard.

200815.text: The one you saved from the cave on the hillside? Don't worry. Leave her to me and I'll take care of her. You just go on your way!

200816.text: This is the castle of the Saintess Cersivey at the mountaintop of Snegurochka.

200817.text: After the War of Protectors, in order to create the Eternal Winter, Saintess Cersivey set up a magic circle here to control the climate of this world.

200818.text: As the blizzard blew everywhere, the snow piled up and the ice built up, thus began the Eternal Winter.

200819.text: We'll have to ask the Saintess herself... But she's not someone who can easily be persuaded, meow.

200820.text: Alas... She's stubborn and against everything about Ereshkigal.

200821.text: Even without any guidance, you still have chosen to...

200822.text: I've said too much already. Cersivey will most likely see you as her enemy the moment she lays eyes on you.

200825.text: Hey, I've got some new information. Wanna hear about it?

200826.text: The Holy Church has also sent someone who claims to be the Executor.

200827.text: Yes. The Holy Church believes in the Supreme God and considers the Neo Church that worships other gods heretic.

200829.text: Is that... Oh, you poor little thing. Are you injured?

200831.text: This is the Hall of Snegurochka, where the Chrono Tower and Snegurochka Mountain meet, and the Endpoint of the Intangible Radius stands. I can almost sense the turbulence on the other side of the door, meow.

200832.text: Those guys will definitely pass through here when they go hunting. We should dig deeper.

200833.text: Even this area has no prey? Looks like those guys are struggling too.

200834.text: It's also very hard over here. We have to find a way out of this situation!

200835.text: Still getting reprimanded ruthlessly, even when hurt...

200836.text: I twisted my back a couple of days ago, and I'm in need of a sturdy crutch.

200837.text: It's just that no wood around here is suitable. There are quite a few strong trees at the hunting grounds in the foothills.

200838.text: Welcome back, my master. It looks like you've found something rare.

200839.text: Yes, that's the seed of the Magic Tree. It will grow into a magic forest after it has absorbed enough magic power.

200840.text: Master, I have a suggestion. Why don't we plant it in the space outside that door?

200841.text: With just a few changes, it can be made into a courtyard for you to rest.

200842.text: Buddy, I haven't taken my vengeance yet! Since you're here now, let my master teach you a lesson!

200843.text: I cannot allow you to stop the blizzard. If it stops, the world will soon end with it.

200844.text: Therefore, to safeguard this world, I shall eliminate you! I cannot allow you to lift the blizzard. Doing so would be dangerous. The survival of the world depends on it.

200845.text: Everyone considers it the origin of the disaster...

200846.text: I've been alone... All the time...

200848.text: Time and space are in disarray. Monsters produced by the Chaos are trying to destroy this world.

200849.text: Only you who inherited the power of the Chronospace Protector can set things right.

200850.text: To think a human can wield such power...

200852.text: Heed my advice and be gone, mortal. Or perhaps you prefer risking your life?

200853.text: I work for the great Chronospace Protector. I am Laksha, the Priest of Time.

200855.text: Yet she was resented by the other Protectors. War inevitably broke out; Lady Ereshkigal failed and was sealed away.

200856.text: Right, if she was still here, how could the Chrono Tower be deserted like this!

200857.text: The human over there seems to have passed out, but it doesn't seem to be anything serious.

200858.text: I'll be here waiting for her to wake up.

200859.text: My master, you don't look well. What happened?

200860.text: I have no memories of my parents. The first memory I have is of the village that raised me.

200861.text: It's a small village by the lake.

200862.text: The people in the village were nice to me. I would have frozen to death if they hadn't taken me in.

200863.text: To repay their kindness, I aided them with my magic to defend against bandits and wolves.

200864.text: My wish is to see the villagers spend their days filled with smiles.

200865.text: Yet, peace did not last for long. Monsters started to show up around the village out of nowhere.

200866.text: Villagers were constantly attacked by those monsters, and casualties kept mounting.

200867.text: These monsters keep showing up. Oh god, why do you punish us like this?

200868.text: More monsters at the village entrance? What can we do!?

200869.text: Every time I get rid of some monsters, new ones quickly take their place.

200870.text: Finally, I found my answer from Arcana the Fortune Teller.

200871.text: These monsters are from the tower deep in the forest. Sometimes they escape the tower and attack the villages nearby.

200872.text: The villagers have requested the lord to form an army and defeat the monsters in the tower.

200873.text: Yet none who entered the tower have ever returned.

200874.text: The villagers also asked the Holy Church for help, but their cries have fallen on deaf ears. The preachers from the Church have done nothing.

200875.text: To bring peace back to the village, I went into the tower to check it out regardless of the objections from the villagers.

200876.text: After all, I have nothing to pay them back with except my magic.

200878.text: You just fell unconscious. Maybe because you're too tired.

200879.text: I see... You must inherit the ability of the Chronospace Protector in order to bring order to the chaos. Please take care of yourself, you can come back here to rest up anytime.

200880.text: Are you sure you are going deep into the forest? It's really dangerous there!

200881.text: The Lord had sent out an army before, yet none ever returned.

200882.text: Yes, exactly. You can't even see the top of that tower. Who knows what's possibly hiding inside.

200883.text: It's way too dangerous to go alone!

200884.text: Going there alone is still too dangerous! Don't try to be a hero!

200885.text: You are right. More people means more strength.

200886.text: Child, we can do nothing more than pray for you.

200887.text: I feel sad, but I don't think we can keep you here.

200888.text: Promise me to run if you are in danger. Don't be a hero.

200890.text: Master, you've been frowning. Did you have a bad dream?

200891.text: A memory, whether real or not, can still be a comfort, giving you the strength to move forward.

200892.text: Master, don't push yourself too hard. Please get some rest, at least for a moment.

200893.text: Did you remember something from the past?

200894.text: The reason that tower contains so many monsters is that there is a point inside that connects to other worlds. That's the Endpoint of the Intangible Radius.

200895.text: Chaos of other worlds has entered the tower through the endpoint.

200896.text: The Chrono Tower contains a large sum of magic by its very nature. That magic has also been affected.

200897.text: They became distorted and transformed into the monsters you see.

200898.text: Even a Protector cannot stop the Intangible from spreading to other worlds.

200899.text: Chaos will keep infiltrating the tower and affecting the world outside.

200900.text: In the end, chaos will destroy not only the villages nearby, but also the entire world outside the tower.

200901.text: Yes. Only you can dispel the chaos from other worlds. That's the origin of the monsters.

200902.text: You are right. Before, this was a prosperous nation of trade, yet now it has fallen into this sad state.

200903.text: In theory, yes. But now it's all up to you. I'm going to rest now. Goodbye.

200904.text: Master, your power is coming back gradually. You can try to resonate. Maybe that can help you.

200905.text: How do you feel? Still having a headache?

200906.text: You were having a fever when you got here. That painful look on your face worried me a lot.

200907.text: Don't even mention it. We are supposed to help each other.

200908.text: That's right. You were alone and passed out in the forest. Naturally, we would save you!

200909.text: Child, we heard that you don't have a home, and even forgot your name?

200910.text: Don't worry, child. You can stay here and consider it your home.

200911.text: Yes! Don't be a stranger. You must be hungry. Come to my place and have a good meal!

200912.text: Welcome to my home. We have been living in this village by the foothills for generations.

200913.text: As you can see, I got hurt in the fight.

200914.text: Please pass this message on to Lord Silverbow.

200915.text: Please ask him to be careful.

200916.text: There were a couple of guys who wanted to visit the mountain top, but none of them came back.

200917.text: People say that the Fallen God at the mountain top killed them.

200918.text: You have some interesting thoughts. But I suggest you give up.

200919.text: You should take this whether you're being serious or not. People around here will be willing to give you a hand once they see this.

200920.text: Do not speak of this nonsense about visiting the mountain top anymore. The blizzard is getting heavier. You should go back to the village and find shelter.

200921.text: Thank you, my friend. You saved me!

200922.text: Young one, you are so naive. Are you trying to settle the conflict for us?

200923.text: That's way too difficult. You should listen to this old geezer and give up!

200924.text: Day by day we are getting less food; therefore, conflicts are inevitable.

200926.text: Negotiating with the wolves? What a crazy idea...

200927.text: Unless the wolves leave first, I have nothing to talk about with Silverbow.

200928.text: As for the wolves, don't even think about them. Just give up now.

200929.text: All right, good luck then, my friend. Be careful not to make yourself their food.

200930.text: Oh! My friend, why are you here? Didn't I ask you to go back to the village?

200931.text: I can't believe what I just heard. Wolves are ferocious animals!

200932.text: You should give up this unrealistic idea!

200934.text: You are going to risk your life for someone you barely know.

200935.text: There's not enough prey already, and I'm afraid the young men in the organization are not that forgiving.

200936.text: My friend, although you seem to know how to wield magic, going up the mountain will still not be easy in any sense.

200937.text: Forget about the horrible Fallen God at the mountain top, my men told me that there's a dire bear on the hillside that is just as dangerous. Be careful!

200939.text: Human, I'm quite sorry. As the leader of the pack, I cannot agree with your request just like that.

200940.text: But thank you for saving this little one.

200942.text: We once attacked it. However, brave as it may sound, the only casualties were my loyal subordinates.

200943.text: We had no choice but to retreat here.

200944.text: You are different from those humans with swords. I don't want you to lose your life for nothing.

200945.text: Go back to your village. No one can change the laws of nature.

200946.text: I can see the determination in your clear eyes... I suppose nothing can stop you from doing this.

200947.text: I will send this child back to her mother. Again, many thanks for your kindness.

200948.text: I'm glad to see you safe and sound.

200949.text: There's been no trace of it so far. Rumor has it that it often smashes the ice surface of the frozen lake with its strong paws as a way to work out its claws.

200950.text: That might be the hunting instinct of those monsters.

200951.text: Come find me if you need any help. This affects our survival as well after all.

200952.text: Another thing. Have you seen some guys in armor? They fled so fast that I lost track of them here.

200953.text: When he was in combat with those men from the Chivalric Order, his baggage was stolen.

200954.text: I feel my body has dulled. Let me test my claws with the ice here first...

200955.text: I'm not proud to say this, but it is thanks to the blizzard that we have managed to survive this long.

200956.text: We are great hunters, which makes us more adaptive to this harsh environment.

200957.text: It seems that the Chivalric Order is behind all this.

200958.text: You are... I suppose you are a human.

200959.text: It's very impressive of you to get here all the way through the blizzard.

200960.text: That's what mortals call me. I am Cersivey, the Protector of Snegurochka.

200961.text: You are the one who defeated all the guards here?

200962.text: To save this world from its total destruction, I created this endless blizzard with magic. It is the only way to prevent the perilous end.

200963.text: I didn't expect the Snow Wolf there would fawn on humans.

200964.text: You are so despicable, trying all kinds of ways to play off us against humans.

200965.text: She's different from you. She sympathizes with us, and strives for our peace and happiness.

200966.text: What an insipid statement. Your kind has been against me all this time, and you still haven't learned your lesson.

200967.text: To prevent this world from breaking apart, I just did what needed to be done.

200968.text: You worthless beings. If you can survive after this, try your best to struggle in this world!

200969.text: No one can stop me from saving my world...

200970.text: It looks like we'll have to defeat this stubborn fool to make the blizzard stop.

200971.text: Are you going into the castle by yourself?

200972.text: Leave her to me and I'll take care of her. Go ahead, don't worry!

200973.text: Will of Blizzard, please protect her on her way!

200974.text: After all, she hates Lady Ereshkigal the most.

200975.text: Meow, just take care. I'm tired and going back to sleep.

200976.text: What a joke...What you're doing will just lead this world to its end.

200979.text: It's the key to restore order to the worlds...

200984.text: Cersivey, the Protector of Snegurochka seems to hate me tremendously, and called me the witch who brings disasters.

200985.text: As if I should have been eliminated in the War of Protectors long ago instead of still being alive in this world.

200986.text: My master, your pain must be beyond my understanding.

200987.text: But everyone has ups and downs. Sadness is just a part of your memory.

200988.text: You have been fighting in the face of countless difficulties from different worlds. That's why only those sad memories have been triggered.

200989.text: You worry about hurting others because you're a kind-hearted person.

200990.text: Yet, please believe that you have the power to change fate.

200991.text: You have already changed the fate of Irminsul and Snegurochka.

200992.text: Your memory is gradually coming back, though it's still mostly blank now.

200993.text: It's painful at the beginning, but you will definitely find the answers to all your questions eventually.

200994.text: I am your maid. For me, you are the whole world.

200995.text: It goes without saying that I will always stand by your side and support your decisions.

200996.text: You hard nuts, bring it on! The descendant of Agilolfing knows no fear.

200998.text: I am Bluen Agilolfing, the last of the Agilolfings.

200999.text: I hired an alchemist to enter the tower with me, but never thought I would encounter a woman who just shapeshifted into a monster.

201000.text: To save me, Dejase has distracted that woman on her own. I was still caught up by some monsters when I was retreating to the lower floors of the tower.

201002.text: Dejase is facing danger all by herself... I'm not sure how she is right now...

201003.text: Oh, so you have met Dejase... Though she's not much of a talker, she is amazingly talented.

201004.text: Yet, confronting so many monsters alone is way too dangerous!

201005.text: We were attacked on a floor up there, and she managed to distract that shapeshifted woman by running upstairs alone.

201006.text: Oh, thank you so much. But please be careful! Stay safe!

201010.text: Her heart has stopped beating. Sadness is meaningless.

201012.text: Then don't be sad. She's already gone.

201015.text: The power of Ereshkigal has finally awoken?

201016.text: Uh, so you've already understood what Erina explained.

201017.text: You felt powerless after witnessing the death of others.

201018.text: And then your grief awakened the ability of shifting.

201019.text: Time may be turned back, but the history that has already transpired can't be changed.

201020.text: So even if you return to the past, karma cannot be changed. Humans will always feel powerless standing in front of the Chronospace.

201021.text: Yet you can revise karma during Intangible Shifting.

201022.text: Yes. Intangible Shifting is a Chronospace Magic that consists of time-shifting and space-shifting.

201023.text: We went to Irminsul and Snegurochka thanks to the space shifting.

201024.text: But in that course, time cannot be changed.

201025.text: If you want to rewrite history, you have to change karma when time is shifted.

201026.text: It's the most advanced Chronospace Magic that used to be mastered by Lady Ereshkigal alone.

201027.text: Master, your ability of jumping through time has awoken. Despite still being unstable, it offers you possibilities to rewrite the fate of the worlds.

201028.text: Yes. You are at the upstream of the timeline, namely a point in the past.

201030.text: My master, Intangible Shifting requires a large amount of magic.

201031.text: We could go to other worlds before because we borrowed the magic held in certain items.

201032.text: Now that you have unleashed Chronospace Magic by yourself, it must have inflicted a great burden on your body. Please don't push yourself too hard.

201033.text: You intruders, dare to pry into the forbidden magic?!

201034.text: The evil incarnation is just as described in the tales, emitting a repugnant aura.

201036.text: The scent of something forbidden is always intoxicating.

201038.text: I'll use my Fire Magic to distract her. Bluen, you seize the chance to run towards the bottom of the tower.

201039.text: Ugh. Is this as far as I can get...

201043.text: Why do you have such strong magic...

201044.text: As a gifted alchemist, how come I was just saved by you...

201045.text: This is because I haven't done enough research...

201046.text: I will have the ultimate magic power once my research is done. I am the only chosen one.

201047.text: I'll get stronger, for I am the true heir of magic!

201051.text: Oh, you are the one Deluca mentioned before...

201053.text: Deluca speaks very highly of you. Would you lend me a hand?

201056.text: I hired her. Her research on mysterious things is an important cornerstone of restoring my family's former glory.

201057.text: You know, it's hard to find the hidden treasure merely on my own.

201058.text: Uh, that's the scroll I found in The Church's library. It documented clues to the ancient treasure.

201059.text: Rumor has it that you can find the lost magic with this scroll.

201060.text: I made a copy of it. If you find anything, please keep me posted.

201061.text: Human with silver hair, here you are...

201062.text: Well, what I know is quite limited.

201063.text: Followers like us can only be in awe of the greatness of the Chronospace Protector.

201065.text: I've been here ever since I started to follow the Protector. Never have I heard about any treasure...

201066.text: Human with silver hair, You must have a strong connection with us.

201067.text: You should also believe in the Chronospace Protector and obey her will.

201068.text: Is that so... Well, one day, you will join us.

201069.text: The more you explore the darkness, the more you will yearn for our warmth.

201070.text: One day, you will join us.

201071.text: Hey, what are you doing here?
